AVIATION
March 22, 1930
COMING EVENTS-
Will your City
Fit Into The Air Transport
Map of The Future?
Cities that built adequate airports several years ago
are today reaping the benefits in airplane factories, air
transport lines and other business attracted by modern
air facilities. *> Five years hence, many more cities will
be marked as air transport terminals by reason of having
provided the necessary airports. * » If your town is con-
sidering an airport, it will pay you to avail yourself of our
specialized knowledge and experience in every step of the
project... from site selection to actual operation.
AIRPORT
DEVELOPMENT & CONSTRUCTION CO.
PHILADELPHIA
CONSULTANTS • ENGINEERS • BUILDERS

you our booklet.

properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of the Captain John B. Russell Family
properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from March 22, 1930 issue of Aviation magazine for Airport Development & Construction Company, Philadelphia, titled “Coming events - Will your city fit into the air transport map of the future?” with black and white illustration depicting planform shadow of aircraft projected over city grid; separate advertisement on reverse for Port Oxford Cedar Products Company (manufacturer of Co-ve-co aircraft plywood) featuring Charles Lindbergh’s monoplane.
properties.wof:name: advertisement: Airport Development & Construction Company
